message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper is about skeleton-based action recognition using graph convolutional networks. The most relevant sub-category is likely cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), as the paper deals with analyzing and recognizing human actions from skeleton data. The use of deep learning models and the focus on improving recognition accuracy also suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are likely sub-categories. Additionally, the use of spatiotemporal graphs and the exploration of second-order information in the skeleton data suggest that cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) could also be relevant sub-categories.
